description: Spotify says that because online streaming services let users listen to anything they want, people are increasingly breaking away from rigid genres.
title: Daily Report: Spotify and the End of Musical Genres
title_page: Daily Report: Spotify and the End of Musical Genres - The New York Times
text:
Photo
Farhad Manjoo writes that there’s a reason his two children, ages 4 and 2, have suddenly become obsessed with Simon and Garfunkel, not long after fixations on Maroon 5 and Michael Jackson.
Spotify says that because online streaming services let us call up and listen to anything we like, and because its curated playlists push us toward new stuff, we are all increasingly escaping rigid genres.
That trend looks sure to accelerate as streaming becomes ubiquitous. Spotify, with its new version of the app, is even betting that fixed musical genres will fade away. Read more »
